fields.name: Label_CaseSwarmingFlows_SlackChannelCreationFailed
fields.fieldText: There was a problem creating the Slack Channel

fields.name: EndTextMessage
fields.fieldText: Your org is missing a Service Channel for this Swarm Member, or skills, or both. To run Swarming flows, set up Omni-Channel and add both the Service Channel for the Swarm Member and required skills.

fields.name: FinishText
fields.fieldText: The Begin Swarming flow is complete.

fields.name: Label_CaseSwarmingFlows_GetCollaborationSettingActionFailed
fields.fieldText: The flow cannot be continued because certain permissions need to be enabled

fields.name: Multi_Swarm_Message
fields.fieldText: One or more swarms are associated with this record. To swarm with the same swarm members, reopen an existing swarm. To swarm with new members, start a new swarm and give the channel a custom name to differentiate it from your existing swarms.

screens.description: Can't add bot to private channel
screens.name: Private_Channel
screens.label: Private Channel

fields.name: Private_Channel_Message
fields.fieldText: To swarm in a private channel, add the Service Cloud for Slack app from the Integrations tab.

fields.name: SelectHowToSwarm
fields.fieldText: How would you like to swarm?

fields.name: SetUpYourSwarmChannel
fields.fieldText: Set up your swarm channel and swarm record. To avoid duplicate names, you can customize the channel and record names.

validationRule.errorMessage: Enter a title that includes lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only.

fields.name: PrivateChannel
fields.fieldText: Channels are public by default, but you can make a public channel private in Slack at any time.

fields.name: SlackSetupChannel
fields.fieldText: Set up your swarm channel and swarm record. To avoid duplicate names, you can customize the channel and record names.

fields.name: AddAppToChannelNote
fields.fieldText: Note: The Service app must be in the Slack integrations tab to use swarming flows in an existing channel
